member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc.Razor.IViewLocationExpander
member.summary: Specifies the contracts for a view location expander that is used by instances to determine search paths for a view.
member.remarks: Individual s are invoked in two steps: (1) is invoked and each expander adds values that it would later consume as part of . The populated values are used to determine a cache key - if all values are identical to the last time was invoked, the cached result is used as the view location. (2) If no result was found in the cache or if a view was not found at the cached location, is invoked to determine all potential paths for a view.

member.summary: Invoked by a to determine the values that would be consumed by this instance of . The calculated values are used to determine if the view location has changed since the last time it was located.
member.param: The for the current view location expansion operation.

member.summary: Invoked by a to determine potential locations for a view.
member.param: The for the current view location expansion operation.
The sequence of view locations to expand.
member.returns: A list of expanded view locations.

member.summary: In layout pages, asynchronously renders the content of the section named .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc.Razor.RazorPage.FlushAsync
member.summary: Invokes on writing out any buffered content to the .
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous flush operation and on completion returns a .
member.remarks: The value returned is a token value that allows FlushAsync to work directly in an HTML section. However the value does not represent the rendered content. This method also writes out headers, so any modifications to headers must be done before is called. For example, call to send antiforgery cookie token and X-Frame-Options header to client before this method flushes headers out.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc.Razor.RazorPage.SetAntiforgeryCookieAndHeader
member.summary: Sets antiforgery cookie and X-Frame-Options header on the response.
member.returns: A that returns a .
member.remarks: Call this method to send antiforgery cookie token and X-Frame-Options header to client before flushes the headers.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc.Razor.RazorTextWriter
member.summary: An that is backed by a unbuffered writer (over the Response stream) and a buffered . When Flush or FlushAsync is invoked, the writer copies all content from the buffered writer to the unbuffered one and switches to writing to the unbuffered writer for all further write operations.
member.remarks: This type is designed to avoid creating large in-memory strings when buffering and supporting the contract that expects.

member.summary: Copies the buffered content to the unbuffered writer and invokes flush on it. Additionally causes this instance to no longer buffer and direct all write operations to the unbuffered writer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc.Razor.RazorViewEngine
member.summary: Default implementation of .
member.remarks: For ViewResults returned from controllers, views should be located in by default. For the controllers in an area, views should exist in .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc.Razor.RazorViewEngine.#ctor(Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc.Razor.IRazorPageFactory,Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc.Razor.IRazorViewFactory,Microsoft.Extensions.OptionsModel.IOptions{Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc.Razor.RazorViewEngineOptions},Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc.Razor.IViewLocationCache)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The page factory used for creating instances.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc.Razor.RazorViewEngine.ViewLocationFormats
member.summary: Gets the locations where this instance of will search for views.
member.remarks: The locations of the views returned from controllers that do not belong to an area. Locations are composite format strings (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/txafckwd.aspx), which contains following indexes: {0} - Action Name {1} - Controller Name The values for these locations are case-sensitive on case-senstive file systems. For example, the view for the Test action of HomeController should be located at /Views/Home/Test.cshtml. Locations such as /views/home/test.cshtml would not be discovered

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc.Razor.RazorViewEngine.AreaViewLocationFormats
member.summary: Gets the locations where this instance of will search for views within an area.
member.remarks: The locations of the views returned from controllers that belong to an area. Locations are composite format strings (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/txafckwd.aspx), which contains following indexes: {0} - Action Name {1} - Controller Name {2} - Area name The values for these locations are case-sensitive on case-senstive file systems. For example, the view for the Test action of HomeController should be located at /Views/Home/Test.cshtml. Locations such as /views/home/test.cshtml would not be discovered

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc.Razor.RazorViewEngine.GetNormalizedRouteValue(Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc.ActionContext,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the case-normalized route value for the specified route .
member.returns: The value corresponding to the key.
member.remarks: The casing of a route value in is determined by the client. This making constructing paths for view locations in a case sensitive file system unreliable. Using the for attribute routes and for traditional routes to get route values produces consistently cased results.

Unexpected return value from '{1}.{2}' for URL '{0}'. If the '{1}' service has been overridden, change '{2}' to replace only the '~/' prefix. Otherwise, add the following directive to the Razor page to disable URL resolution relative to the application's 'webroot' setting:
@{3} "{4}, {5}"

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Internal.PropertyHelper.GetVisibleProperties(System.Object)

summary.para: Creates and caches fast property helpers that expose getters for every non-hidden get property on the specified type.
excludes properties defined on base types that have been hidden by definitions using the new keyword.

member.param: The instance to extract property accessors for.
member.returns: A cached array of all public property getters from the instance's type.

summary.para: Creates a caches fast property helpers that expose getters for every non-hidden get property on the specified type.
excludes properties defined on base types that have been hidden by definitions using the new keyword.

member.returns: A cached array of all public property getters from the type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Internal.PropertyHelper.MakeFastPropertyGetter(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: Creates a single fast property getter. The result is not cached.
member.param: propertyInfo to extract the getter for.
member.returns: a fast getter.
member.remarks: This method is more memory efficient than a dynamically compiled lambda, and about the same speed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Internal.PropertyHelper.MakeNullSafeFastPropertyGetter(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: Creates a single fast property getter which is safe for a null input object. The result is not cached.
member.param: propertyInfo to extract the getter for.
member.returns: a fast getter.
member.remarks: This method is more memory efficient than a dynamically compiled lambda, and about the same speed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Internal.PropertyHelper.MakeFastPropertySetter(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: Creates a single fast property setter for reference types. The result is not cached.
member.param: propertyInfo to extract the setter for.
member.returns: a fast getter.
member.remarks: This method is more memory efficient than a dynamically compiled lambda, and about the same speed. This only works for reference types.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Internal.PropertyHelper.ObjectToDictionary(System.Object)
member.summary:
Given an object, adds each instance property with a public get method as a key and its associated value to a dictionary.
If the object is already an instance, then a copy is returned.
member.remarks: The implementation of PropertyHelper will cache the property accessors per-type. This is faster when the the same type is used multiple times with ObjectToDictionary.
